image.altText: woman looking out window

props.synopsis: There’s a push for stricter regulation of the massage industry, after a practitioner was able to keep indecently assaulting his clients after being reported to police and an industry body. Data shows the issue could be widespread.

title.children: Is this self-regulated industry a breeding ground for predators?

image.altText: Police officers standing on a street with police tape

props.synopsis: A woman has been rushed to hospital in a critical condition, and a man charged with attempted murder, after an alleged domestic assault in Adelaide's north-west.

title.children: Stabbing victim in critical condition after suspected domestic assault in Adelaide's north-west

image.altText: A woman in a wheelchair at the beach

props.synopsis: An Adelaide woman has called for the expansion of South Australia's beach access program to encourage more people with disabilities to enjoy the ocean.

title.children: Calls to expand SA beach access so ocean can be enjoyed by all

image.altText: A giant burrowing cockroach resting on its back in cupped hands

props.synopsis: While people pay good money to get rid of cockroaches and other creepy-crawlies, Kris Messenger has dedicated her life to spruiking the benefits of bugs. But she says demand for them as pets can have an impact on ecosystems if they are poached from the wild.

title.children: This $80 native cockroach is a popular pet, but there's a dark side to the industry

image.altText: A Facebook photo of former professional cyclist Melissa Hoskins.

props.synopsis: Loved ones of Olympic cyclist Melissa Hoskins will be given the chance to deliver victim impact statements at the next court appearance of Rohan Dennis, who last month pleaded guilty over the incident which resulted in his wife's death.

title.children: Court anticipates victim impact statements following death of Melissa Hoskins

image.altText: A man holds a photo of an elderly woman

props.synopsis: A 93-year-old man has been found mentally unfit to stand trial for the murder of his wife, and therefore not guilty.

title.children: Children of 85yo woman killed by her husband can't forgive 'evil act'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese calls for reform and renewal in the health and education sectors

props.synopsis: Two more states have agreed to sign on to the federal government's new school funding agreement, which will see the Commonwealth lift its share of public school funding to 25 per cent.

title.children: Significant progress to ending the school funding wars as two more states sign on

image.altText: Two power transmission towers in the middle on an open field with a sunrise in the background.,

props.synopsis: Six months after they were mothballed by their parent company two diesel generators could be turned back on to help power South Australia this summer.

title.children: AEMO permitted to switch on South Australian diesel generators during shortfall

image.altText: A court build with a columned verandah and a blue coloured building behind

props.synopsis: A lawyer whose experience of sexual harassment prompted the dismissal of a South Australian magistrate doubts the findings of a second review of the legal profession will spark immediate change.

title.children: Sexual harassment still ‘systemic’ in legal profession, says lawyer

image.altText: A semi-trailer trailer on fire at night

props.synopsis: A semitrailer carrying toilet paper catches fire while driving through dry farmland and pine forests in south-western Victoria, but "luck" and cooperation prevent the blaze from causing a much larger disaster.

title.children: Truck carrying toilet paper bursts into flames but bushfire prevented

image.altText: Head of a man coloured pink with a beard with questions swirling around green and yellow background

props.synopsis: With more Australians than ever being diagnosed with ADHD, how do the treatments on offer stack up?

title.children: ADHD diagnoses are skyrocketing but coaching can help

image.altText: Neale Daniher

props.synopsis: The Australian of the Year for 2025 is Neale Daniher, while the co-founders of social enterprise Cafe Stepping Stone are jointly named Local Heroes, a chemistry researcher is named Young Australian of the Year and the co-founder of Wheelchairs for Kids is Senior Australian of the Year.

title.children: AFL great fighting motor neurone disease is 2025 Australian of the Year

image.altText: a woman wearing eye covering in a laboratory

props.synopsis: Aboriginal leaders, domestic violence prevention advocates, a master of traditional embroidery and a Scrabble champion are among the 732 Australians recognised in the 2025 Australia Day honours list.

title.children: See who's been recognised in the 2025 Australia Day honours list

image.altText: Donald Trump stands in front of supporters and a sign that says 'no tax on tips'

props.synopsis: The Trump administration fires about 17 independent inspectors-general at government agencies, an action some fear will remove oversight of his new administration.

title.children: Trump fires multiple watchdogs in late-night move

image.altText: A Japanese man wearing a ponytail looks around in shock clutching a pillow to his naked body.

props.synopsis: Nasubi spent 18 months naked and alone in a room for a TV show. His story may seem extreme but it continues to serve as a cautionary tale about the pursuit of celebrity status, and the power of manipulation.

title.children: Naked, starved and watched by millions: Inside Japan's Truman Show 'hell'

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka looks at the Australian Open trophy after losing the final to Madison Keys.

props.synopsis: Madison Keys exorcises some grand slam demons as a rare underdog making good in Melbourne, while Aryna Sabalenka comes to terms with losing. Here are the quick hits from the penultimate day of the Australian Open.

title.children: Five quick hits: Sabalenka 'hates' her team as Keys makes good

image.altText: GettyImages-2167325374

props.synopsis: After 15 days and 125 matches, the top two seeds will meet in the final match of the Australian Open. Find out where the showdown between Jannik Sinner and Alexander Zverev will be won and lost.

title.children: The style and substance that will decide the Australian Open men's final

image.altText: Nuclear cooling towers

props.synopsis: Nuclear power has been gaining more interest and attention at global climate summits, as a key weapon in the fight against climate change. But climate advocates say it's still suffering from a terrible reputation.

title.children: As Australia weighs up nuclear power, some see hope — or hype

image.altText: Aerial photo of Port Hinchinbrook

props.synopsis: A hole in a soil pond wall in north Queensland has allowed potentially toxic material to seep through to two world heritage areas.

title.children: Wall dividing toxic dumping ground and Great Barrier Reef has a hole

image.altText: A close up shot of police tape with cars parked on a street and trees blurred in the background

props.synopsis: Police charge a 75-year-old woman with the alleged murder of her retirement village roommate in Port Kennedy, south of Perth.

title.children: Woman, 75, charged with alleged murder of retirement village roommate

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Three Torres Strait men in traditional dress, holding bows and arrows and a conch shell on a jetty with ocean in background.

props.synopsis: This remote corner of Australia could rival the world's top getaways. But getting travellers to the region is just one of numerous challenges facing the First Nations entrepreneurs trying to build a local industry.

title.children: Australia's 'undiscovered island' wants more tourists to visit

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: I hope you like disappointment 'cos you're about to feel it, HARD!

title.children: Can your two brain cells handle this quiz? I wouldn't count on it

image.altText: A crowd in front of a screen with Elon Musk

props.synopsis: Meanwhile, thousands of protesters turned out against the AfD across Germany as the European nation prepares to head to legislative elections.

title.children: Musk tells German far-right party it's the 'best hope for the future'

image.altText: Asian people in masks stand around as a car enters a large structure

props.synopsis: The CIA notes it has "low confidence" in its assessment and maintains its occurrence in nature also remains plausible.

title.children: CIA says it's 'more likely' COVID came from a lab than from nature

image.altText: A Vietnamese man takes his children on a motorbike past a rusting US tank

props.synopsis: Fifty years after the Vietnam War, South Vietnamese veterans and their families are still battling political and logistical obstacles to recovering the remains of their fallen.

title.children: 'To erase us': These Vietnamese veterans can't find their dead

image.altText: A surfer mid flight off the Pilbara coast

props.synopsis: Pilbara surfers have relished a recent tropical cyclone which, despite remaining offshore, brought a rare chance to surf in areas that only break during big storms.

title.children: For these remote cyclone surfers, a storm is something to celebrate

image.altText: Darcie Brown appears to be in mid-air as she completes a delivery while an England batter stands near her

props.synopsis: Australia completes a comprehensive 72-run win over a poor England outfit in the third T20 at Adelaide Oval, keeping hopes alive of a Women's Ashes series whitewash.

title.children: Australia smashes dismal England in third T20 to close in on Ashes whitewash

image.altText: A middle-aged bald man with glasses in a suit speaks outside.

props.synopsis: The opposition leader's refreshed line-up follows the prime minister announcing changes to his frontbench earlier this month ahead of an upcoming federal election.

title.children: Peter Dutton announces long-awaited frontbench shake-up

image.altText: an empty hospital bed in a corridor

props.synopsis: Public hospitals are preparing to shut seven mental health wards across New South Wales after more than 200 public psychiatrists resigned over a lack of pay.

title.children: More than 70 Sydney hospital beds to shut as psychiatrists resign

image.altText: PM Anthony Albanese stands alongside his fiancee Jodie Haydon and Grace Tame.

props.synopsis: The former Australian of the Year has called out the Murdoch media empire, wearing a T-shirt with the slogan "F*** Murdoch" during a morning tea with Anthony Albanese.

title.children: Grace Tame shakes up PM's morning tea with anti-Murdoch T-shirt

image.altText: A photo of Chappell Roan in red and white leather top surrounded by butterflies on a red and yellow background

props.synopsis: With the most number of votes in the history of the Hottest 100, the Midwest Princess dominated the list.

title.children: Chappell Roan wins Hottest 100 with history-making debut

image.altText: Neale Daniher, wife Jan and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese on the AOTY.

props.synopsis: The AFL legend has raised more than $100 million for research into a cure for Motor Neurone Disease after his diagnosis in 2013. He is no longer able to talk, so his daughter Rebecca spoke with Radio National's Sunday Extra.

title.children: Listen: Neale Daniher's daughter on his work to become Australian of the Year

image.altText: A police car in a driveway

props.synopsis: A woman is charged over the death of a nine-year-old boy in north Queensland.

title.children: Woman charged over death of nine-year-old boy in Townsville

image.altText: a pink sky with the silhouette of a palm tree in the foreground

props.synopsis: The onset of the Northern Territory's monsoon will be the latest on record in 2025, having surpassed the previous record in 1973.

title.children: Delayed onset to NT monsoon season now latest on record
